judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Ctjeiam,
Since the appellant has no standing to appeal, the appeal is quashed. Costs on the appellant.
opinions.author: Pee Ctjeiam,

attorneys: Harold E. Martin, with him Marshall M. Cohen, for appellant.
James F. Heinly, with him Newcomer, Boda é Morgan, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Kauffman Estate.
Argued April 29, 1971.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
reargument refused August 5, 1971.
Harold E. Martin, with him Marshall M. Cohen, for appellant.
James F. Heinly, with him Newcomer, Boda é Morgan, for appellee.
June 28, 1971:
